title: Basic Dashi
steps: Add the cold water and kombu to a pot (if using niboshi or shiitake, add with the kombu).
Heat over medium-low heat until just below simmer, around 80Â°C.
Turn off the heat and allow it to steep for 10 minutes.
Remove the kombu, add the katsuobushi (if using).
Bring up to a simmer, then turn off the heat again, cover, and allow to steep until flavored to your liking, anywhere from 5 minutes to 30 minutes.
Strain through a fine-mesh strainer and reserve until needed.
notes: This is an all-purpose dashi. If you're not sure where to start, this is a safe bet.

Some variants suggest an overnight soak before cooking. To do this, combine the kombu (and niboshi or shiitake, if using) and water, place in the fridge for 12-24 hours before cooking, then proceed with step 2.
Dashi degrades quickly in flavor, so it only keeps for a few days in the fridge.
Can be used to thin out thick soups or as part of the 'double soup' technique.
From 'The Book of Ramen' - Chapter 2: Soup
